content: commuter fingerless mitts a knitting pattern by laura sapergia this is a home sweet home publication biking will save the world the commuter mitts are a big huge thank-you to all the commuters who are out there biking their way to work or school everyday sometimes it is harder/colder/wetter to commute but you do it anyways here is a pair of mitts to keep your hands a little warmer for those rides that are just a bit uncomfortable theyʼll keep you stylish and warm while you dodge traffic leap across intersections and stop criminals in their tracks thanks for making the world a saf er plac e you are a superhero sizes small/medium large recommended yarn cascade yarns ecological wool 250g 437m <1skein recommended needle size us size 5 /5 5mm double pointed needles suggested fingerless mitts a knitting pattern by laura sapergia this is a home sweet home publication pattern notes the left and right mitts have identical construction so make 2 the cuff is worked in a 1x1 rib and the thumb gusset increases are done with m1l and m1r increases which are symmetrical if you prefer another increase technique feel free to substitute it without guilt standard abbreviations for home sweet home patterns can be found at http //yerhomesweethome blogspot com/p/knitting html directions cuff cast on 27 31 sts join in the round do not twist place marker if using round 1 * k1 p1
